title: Ringworm Children - X-rayed to death in Israel, 1950ies
description:
Video : DIVX, 720x480, 44:41  
Audio codec: mp3, 48 kHz, stereo 
Languages: Hebrew spoken, English hard subtitles

In 2004 this film was shown in Israel at the international film 
festival of Haifa (where it won the prize for &#039;Best Documentary&#039;) 
and also on Channel 10.


X-RAYED TO DEATH IN ISRAEL IN THE 1950&#039;S: 

When the USA were founded it was to be the land of the free, 
yet it took almost another 100 years for slavery to be abolished 
(formally) and the aftereffects can still be seen in a society 
that is somewhat segregated. Even as late as 1970 medical 
experiments were conducted on African Americans without their 
consent or knowledge (e.g. the Tuskegee Syphilis Study).

The State of Israel was founded in 1948 in order, amongst 
others, to provide a safehaven for Jews where they would not have 
to fear persecution. The Zionist movement spearheaded the way 
to Aliya (return to Israel) and was largely composed of Ashkenazi 
Jews (mainly of Middle and Northern European descent) who later 
became the dominant group in the state, many of them bringing 
with them a feeling of European superiority, while Mizrahi Jews 
(mainly from Arabic speaking countries like  Morocco and Iraq) 
were implicitly regarded as second or even third class citizens, 
often having a darker skin tone, dark hair and speaking Arabic 
at home. They were frequently perceived as simple, poor, criminal, 
uncultured, unhygenic, diseased and possibly even a security 
risk (apocalyptic fantasies of officials then included political 
rebellion and siding with the Palestinians). 

In this documentary a sad and disturbing chapter of Israel&#039;s 
history is unveiled when Jewish survivors of medical maltreatment 
with hot wax and X-rays (officially to treat ringworm, a minor 
skin disease) tell the story of what Israeli government employees 
brought upon them. It appears that many were subjected to the 
program even if they did not have ringworm (almost like a cleansing
ritual).

Most of the mistreated 100,000 or so Mizrahi Jews were children, 
some died a few weeks after been given an X-ray overdose to their 
heads, many more died before old age of leukemia or are still 
plagued by chancer and other radiation related conditions. 

The program was administered by the Israeli Ministry for Health 
under the title of &#039;social medicine&#039; and the pretext of ringworm 
treatment, the funding and the 7 X-ray machines may have been 
provided by the US government. The then head of the public medical 
services in Israel states that the Isreali government received 300 
million pounds for conducting the program (at the time a lot more 
than the annual Israeli budget) which does not show up in the public 
accounts of the time. The radiation treatment of ringworm had led 
to many court cases in the USA in the 1940ies and often the courts 
awarded high damages for the aftereffects. 

In the 1995 the Israeli parliament passed legislation providing  
compensation for victims of the X-ray &#039;ringworm treatment&#039;. This 
step was taken to avoid a Supreme Court ruling on the matter which 
may have awarded higher damage compensation after investigating the 
cases in detail. But for many victims this measure brought further 
humiliation and no true recognition of their suffering. 

Why were the parents not informed and pressured into sending 
their children on a &#039;trip&#039;?
Was it a systematic genocide as part of a cynical experiment? 
Did a doctor execute a destructive plan without anybody else 
noticing or knowing? 
Are the Israeli authorities at present covering up just out of 
embarrassment about negligence or was there premeditated 
involvement of the highest government circles at the time?

Genocide is a crime punishable under international law. The &#039;Convention 
on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide&#039; (signed 
by Israel in 1949 and ratified in 1950) defines GENOCIDE as follows: 

Article 2 

...any of the following acts committed with intent to destroy, 
in whole or in part, a national, ethnical, racial or religious 
group, as such:

    (a) Killing members of the group;
    (b) Causing serious bodily or mental harm to members of the group;
    (c) Deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life 
calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part;
    (d) Imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group;
    (e) Forcibly transferring children of the group to another group.
